normalised: Hey auto enthusiasts! The E V charging game in India is about to get a serious upgrade. Word on the street or should we say, on the highway? is that I I T Bombay is cooking up some seriously cool charging tech. We are talking faster charging times and more efficient power distribution, which is music to the ears of any Tata Nexon E V owner stuck in Bandra traffic.

unnormalised: Hey auto enthusiasts! The EV charging game in India is about to get a serious upgrade. Word on the street (or should we say, on the highway?) is that IIT Bombay is cooking up some seriously cool charging tech. We're talking faster charging times and more efficient power distribution, which is music to the ears of any Tata Nexon EV owner stuck in Bandra traffic.
normalised: Remember that scene in Dhoom where they needed a nitro boost? Well, these new charging stations might just be the E V equivalent. Apparently, they are aiming for a national standard, with chargers popping up everywhere from Chennai to Chandigarh. Imagine, no more range anxiety on that Leh-Ladakh road trip!

unnormalised: Remember that scene in Dhoom where they needed a nitro boost? Well, these new charging stations might just be the EV equivalent. Apparently, they're aiming for a national standard, with chargers popping up everywhere from Chennai to Chandigarh. Imagine, no more range anxiety on that Leh-Ladakh road trip!
normalised: The government is also throwing some serious rupees into expanding the charging infrastructure. They are talking about installing high-speed chargers every fifty kilometer on major highways. Now, if only they could do something about the potholes too...

unnormalised: The government is also throwing some serious Rs. into expanding the charging infrastructure. They're talking about installing high-speed chargers every 50 km on major highways. Now, if only they could do something about the potholes too...
normalised: Some startups are even experimenting with solar-powered charging kiosks. Eco-friendly and convenient? Wah! Could be the future, folks. Time to trade in that old Maruti eight hundred!
